column4: have you tried nspluginwrapper --help      to see what ways to use it?
you want to run nspluginwrapper -i libflashplayer.so         on the flashplayer plugin file, im not sure exactly where its located but eek_teh_cat is looking for it too, so you two help eachother :)
hmm, thats really strange, i dont know why it wouldnt be working to be honest with you, im not using ubuntu, but i am using a 64 bit version of a different distro, and thats how i did it
